page.title: 09Gardens in Stevington
page.content: We live up to our reputation as a nation of gardeners.The weather,so changeable and unpredictable that it forms a constant topic of conversation works to our advantage.Vegetables which need water to survive are widely grown _ brassicas,potatoes,runner and broad beans.Soft fruits are popular _ strawberries,raspberries,gooseberries and blackcurrants.Apple trees grow in many gardens.We sentimentalise over our flowers.Such plants as dahlias and pelargoniums,more suited to a Mediterranean climate are grown under glass or on house window sills to protect them from winter frosts.We take pride in our lawns which, in season,are mown twice a week.Our efforts in 1985 have gained us the award of best kept small village in the county.Our gardens reward us with colour and fruit and vegetables to eat
